name: Grape Gazpacho
headline: Grape Gazpacho

keywords: Easy Appetizer,Appetizer,Easy Main Dish,Main Dish,Soup,Fruit,Grape Recipes,Tomatillos,Apple Recipes,Cucumber,Nut Recipes,Gluten Free,Vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 1 small cucumber, seeded and chopped (approximately 1 cup)
1 Granny Smith apple, peeled, cored, and chopped (approximately 1 cup)

recipeInstructions.text: Place half of the cucumbers, apples, and tomatillos into the bowl of a food processor. Add all of the grapes, walnuts, yogurt, grape juice, vinegar, and mint. Pulse 9 to 10 times. Combine with the remaining half of the cucumber, apple, and tomatillo. Season with salt, to taste. Chill for 2 hours in the refrigerator before serving. Serve as an appetizer or soup course.

review.reviewBody: This was my very first experience with tomatillo. I’m not wild about its taste, but somehow the recipe still worked with the combination of grapes and apples — the sweetness offset the sourness of the tomatillos. I threw in some cilantro for good measure and it really made the flavors pop.

Awful!  Best word for it. I made this soup exactly as written in the recipe.  Had planned to serve it to my book club.  I tasted it & thought "weird". Later in the day, my husband tried it.  He thought it was awful.  Said I definitely shouldn't serve it.  Hated to dump it as I had made so much but oh well.  Made another food network cold soup that was fantastic & enjoyed by everyone.  I'm glad I made the decision I did.

Tomatillos with grapes???

Sounds weird but it tastes good. It's kind of a like a soupy fruit salad.

Seved along side a spicy black bean soup. Phenominal together.  The combination of flavors compliment each other perfectly.  Love the grapes, apples with the toasted walnuts.  I added a little jalapeno for a fresh hint of heat with the sweet fruit and earthy toasted nuts.  Just a great cold soup.
Not what I thought it would be at all. This is so delightful with a pleasant burst of freshness. Very sweet, so portions are small.
This was really easy to make.  I skipped the walnuts (don't care for them) and it was a big hit with family and friends.  The recipe was not quite enough; everyone wanted more.

Didn't think this sounded too good, but MAN it is. Very light, very cool, very refreshing on hot summer evenings. Someone said it looked horrible, but I think it looks just fine, looks cool, eats cool, and is good for you. GOOD EATS!
Have to admit it tastes pretty good even though I have to close my eyes and try to forget that it looks like vomit.

I tried this recipe for my wife after seeing it on "Good Eats" recently.  She thought it would be a nice change from traditional gazpacho, and indeed it was.  The tomatoes and the apples/grapes go together a lot better than I first expected.  I'm glad we gave this a shot.

video.name: Cold Gazpacho Soup
video.description: Beat the summer heat with this quick and easy recipe for gazpacho soup.
